For efficient application of these abundant but diverse data sources, it is of fundamental importance to evaluate their consistency. RESULTS: First, we showed that the lists of cancer genes from some major data sources were highly inconsistent in terms of overlapping genes.

publication.title: K Longest Paths Per Gate (KLPG) Test Generation for Scan-Based Sequential Circuits

publication.keyword: Computational Complexity;Industrial Design;Longest Path;Sequential Circuits;Test Generation;
publication.abstract: To detect the smallest delay faults at a fault site, the longest path(s) through it must be tested at full speed. Existing test generation tools are inefficient in automatically identifying the longest testable paths due to the high computational complexity. In this work a test generation methodology for scan-based synchronous sequential circuits is presented, under two at-speed test strategies used

publication.title: A Statistical Fault Coverage Metric for Realistic Path Delay Faults
publication.authors: wangqi qiu,xiang lu,zhuo li,d. m. h. walker
publication.abstract: The path delay fault model is the most realistic model for delay faults. Testing all the paths in a circuit achieves 100% delay fault coverage according to traditional path delay fault coverage metrics. These metrics result in unrealistically low fault coverage if only a subset of paths is tested, and the real test quality is not reflected. For example, the

publication.title: Static Compaction of Delay Tests Considering Power Supply Noise
publication.authors: xiang lu,wangqi qiu,ziding yue,steve fancler,weiping shi,d. m. h. walker
publication.abstract: Excessive power supply noise can lead to overkill during delay test. A static compaction algorithm is described in this paper that prevents such overkill. A power supply noise estimation tool has been built and integrated into the compaction process. Compaction results for KLPG delay tests for ISCAS89 circuits under different power grid environments are presented.

The key idea of asynchronous sampling is to spread the sampling times of the sensor nodes over the time line

In this article, we propose asynchronous sampling that shifts the sampling time instances of sensor nodes from each other. For lossy data gathering scenarios, the proposed approach provides more information about the physical phenomena in terms of increased entropy at a low

publication.title: Synthesis and evaluation of linear motion transitions
publication.keyword: Computer Game;Cross Validation;Empirical Evaluation;Just Noticeable Difference;User Study;Virtual Environment;
publication.abstract: This article develops methods for determining visually appealing motion transitions using linear blending. Motion transitions are segues between two sequences of animation, and are important components for generating compelling animation streams in virtual environments and computer games. Methods involving linear blending are studied because of their efficiency, computational speed, and widespread use. Two methods of transition specification are detailed, center-

publication.title: Analysis of a Variational Approach to Progressive Lens Design
publication.keyword: Boundary Condition;Elliptic Partial Differential Equation;euler-lagrange equation;Existence and Uniqueness;Variational Approach;
publication.abstract: We consider a variational approach to the progressive lens design problem. The corresponding Euler-Lagrange equation is a fourth-order nonlinear elliptic partial differential equation. We analyzed two linearizations of the equation and showed the existence and uniqueness as well as the regularity of the solutions for various boundary conditions. We end with an example of a progressive lens designed by solving

publication.title: Real-time deformation using modal analysis on graphics hardware
publication.jconf: Computer graphics and interactive techniques in Austalasia and South East Asia
publication.keyword: Computer Graphic;Deformable Objects;Floating Point;Graphics Hardware;Interactive Application;Modal Analysis;physics-based modeling;Real Time;
publication.abstract: This paper presents an approach for fast simulating deformable objects that is suitable for interactive applications in computer graphics. Linear modal analysis is often used to simulate small-amplitude deformation. Compared to traditional linear modal analysis where the CPU has been used to calculate the nodal displacements, the vertex program of GPU has been found widely adopted in the current applications.
